trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: .NET Core SDK Overview
trans-unit.target: .NET Core SDK Overview

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: .NET Core Software Development Kit (SDK) is a set of libraries and tools that allow developers to create .NET Core applications and libraries.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core Software Development Kit (SDK) is a set of libraries and tools that allow developers to create .NET Core applications and libraries.

trans-unit.source: This is the package that developers will most likely acquire.
trans-unit.target: This is the package that developers will most likely acquire.

trans-unit.source: It contains the following components:
trans-unit.target: It contains the following components:

trans-unit.source: The .NET Core Command Line Tools that are used to build applications
trans-unit.target: The .NET Core Command Line Tools that are used to build applications

trans-unit.source: .NET Core (libraries and runtime) that allow applications to both be built and run
trans-unit.target: .NET Core (libraries and runtime) that allow applications to both be built and run

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet` driver for running the CLI commands as well as running applications
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet` driver for running the CLI commands as well as running applications

trans-unit.source: Acquiring the .NET Core SDK
trans-unit.target: Acquiring the .NET Core SDK

trans-unit.source: As with any tooling, the first thing is to get the tools to your machine.
trans-unit.target: As with any tooling, the first thing is to get the tools to your machine.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your scenario, you can either use the native installers to install the SDK or use the installation shell script.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your scenario, you can either use the native installers to install the SDK or use the installation shell script.

trans-unit.source: The native installers are primarily meant for developer's machines.
trans-unit.target: The native installers are primarily meant for developer's machines.

trans-unit.source: The SDK is distributed using each supported platform's native install mechanism, for instance DEB packages on Ubuntu or MSI bundles on Windows.
trans-unit.target: The SDK is distributed using each supported platform's native install mechanism, for instance DEB packages on Ubuntu or MSI bundles on Windows.

trans-unit.source: These installers will install and set up the environment as needed for the user to use the SDK immediately after the install.
trans-unit.target: These installers will install and set up the environment as needed for the user to use the SDK immediately after the install.

trans-unit.source: However, they also require administrative privileges on the machine.
trans-unit.target: However, they also require administrative privileges on the machine.

trans-unit.source: You can view the installation instructions on the [.NET Core getting started page](https://aka.ms/dotnetcoregs).
trans-unit.target: You can view the installation instructions on the [.NET Core getting started page](https://aka.ms/dotnetcoregs).

trans-unit.source: Install scripts, on the other hand, do not require administrative privileges.
trans-unit.target: Install scripts, on the other hand, do not require administrative privileges.

trans-unit.source: However, they will also not install any prerequisites on the machine; you need to install all of the prerequisites manually.
trans-unit.target: However, they will also not install any prerequisites on the machine; you need to install all of the prerequisites manually.

trans-unit.source: The scripts are meant mostly for setting up build servers or when you wish to install the tools without admin privileges (do note the prerequisites caveat above).
trans-unit.target: The scripts are meant mostly for setting up build servers or when you wish to install the tools without admin privileges (do note the prerequisites caveat above).

trans-unit.source: You can find more information on the [install script reference topic](tools/dotnet-install-script.md).
trans-unit.target: You can find more information on the [install script reference topic](tools/dotnet-install-script.md).

trans-unit.source: If you are interested in how to set up SDK on your CI build server you can take a look at the [SDK with CI servers](tools/using-ci-with-cli.md) document.
trans-unit.target: If you are interested in how to set up SDK on your CI build server you can take a look at the [SDK with CI servers](tools/using-ci-with-cli.md) document.

trans-unit.source: By default, the SDK will install in a "side-by-side" (SxS) manner.
trans-unit.target: By default, the SDK will install in a "side-by-side" (SxS) manner.

trans-unit.source: This means that multiple versions of the CLI tools can coexist at any given time on a single machine.
trans-unit.target: This means that multiple versions of the CLI tools can coexist at any given time on a single machine.

trans-unit.source: How the correct version gets used is explained in more detail in the [driver section](#driver) below.
trans-unit.target: How the correct version gets used is explained in more detail in the [driver section](#driver) below.
